text: Liasis is a genus of pythons found in Indonesia, New Guinea and Australia. Currently, three extant species are recognized and one giant fossil species L. dubudingala, estimated to have been around 10 m (33 ft) in length. ==Geographic range== They are found in the Indonesia in the Lesser Sunda Islands, east through New Guinea and in northern and western Australia. ==Species== {|cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2 border=1 style="border-collapse: collapse;" !bgcolor="#f0f0f0"|Species !bgcolor="#f0f0f0"|Taxon author !bgcolor="#f0f0f0"|Subsp.* !bgcolor="#f0f0f0"|Common name !bgcolor="#f0f0f0"|Geographic range |- |L. fuscus |Peters, 1873 |align="center"|0 |Water python |style="width:40%"|Australia (Western Australia, Northern Territory and Queensland), the Sir Charles Hardy Islands, Cornwallis Island in the Torres Strait, Papua New Guinea (lower Fly River region) and Indonesia (southern Papua) |- |L. macklotiT 150px |A.M.C. Duméril & Bibron, 1844 |align="center"|2 |Macklot's python |Indonesia in the Lesser Sunda Islands of Roti, Samao, Timor, Wetar and Savu |- |L. olivaceus 150px |Gray, 1842 |align="center"|1 |Olive python |Australia in Western Australia, Northern Territory and Queensland |- |} )*Not including the nominate subspecies )TType species ==References== ==External links== * Category:Snake genera Category:Taxa named by John Edward Gray
title: Liasis
